question.text: Under given suitable conditions, the DPD will be more than OP when

solution.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> . When TP is negative as in a plasmolysed cell than DPD will be more than OP. <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> . In a plasmolysed cell when water from the cytoplasm also moves out than TP becomes negative.
